001import java.util.StringTokenizer;
002
003/**
004 * Class Parser - Takes user input and tries to interpret it as a "Zuul"
005 * command. Every time it is called it takes a line as a String and
006 * tries to interpret the line as a two word command. It returns the command
007 * as an object of class Command.
008 *
009 * The parser has a set of known command words. It checks user input against
010 * the known commands, and if the input is not one of the known commands, it
011 * returns a command object that is marked as an unknown command.
012 * 
013 * This class is part of "World of Zuul". "World of Zuul" is a simple, 
014 * text based adventure game.
015 *
016 * @author  Michael Kolling and David J. Barnes
017 * @version 2.0 (Jan 2003) DB edited (2019)
018 */
019
020public class Parser 
021{
022
023    private CommandWords aCommandWords;  // holds all valid command words
024
025    /**
026     * Create a new Parser.
027     */
028    public Parser() 
029    {
030        this.aCommandWords = new CommandWords();
031    } // Parser()
032
033    /**
034     * Get a new command from the user. The command is read by
035     * parsing the 'inputLine'.
036     * 
037     * @param pInputLine Command from the user to be read.
038     * @return a command after checking if the words are known or not.
039     */
040    public Command getCommand( final String pInputLine ) 
041    {
042        String vWord1;
043        String vWord2;
044
045        StringTokenizer tokenizer = new StringTokenizer( pInputLine );
046
047        if ( tokenizer.hasMoreTokens() )
048            vWord1 = tokenizer.nextToken();      // get first word
049        else
050            vWord1 = null;
051
052        if ( tokenizer.hasMoreTokens() )
053            vWord2 = tokenizer.nextToken();      // get second word
054        else
055            vWord2 = null;
056
057        // note: we just ignore the rest of the input line.
058
059        // Now check whether this word is known. If so, create a command
060        // with it. If not, create a "null" command (for unknown command).
061
062        if ( this.aCommandWords.isCommand( vWord1 ) )
063            return new Command( vWord1, vWord2 );
064        else
065            return new Command( null, vWord2 );
066    } // getCommand(.)
067
068    /**
069     * Returns a String with valid command words.
070     * @return a list of all the valid command words.
071     */
072    public String getCommandString() // was showCommands()
073    {
074        return this.aCommandWords.getCommandList();
075    } // getCommandString()
076
077} // Parser
